intro: Tithymalus tenuifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Tithymalus tenuifolius is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
